title: USC-c port wired audio cuts out when bumped or moved.
content:
My USB-C to 3.5 mm audio adapters don't work well - audio often cuts out. To fix this, I've bought cord protectors, and finally purchased USB-c headphones from the Google Store. 

Unfortunately the USB-c headphones have the same problem as the audio adapters (even worse), and they disconnect/pause audio at very minor movements. I think this may be a USB-c port issue with the phone, however, the phone charges fine, and if there isn't movement, the audio remains connected.  I've tried cleaning the USB-c port on the phone but the issue persists. 

It would be rad if there was an OS fix that identified these slight movements as not a full disconnect, and didn't pause audio. Are there any other potential fixes? I really prefer to have wired headphones rather than use bluetooth ones.

Thanks for your help! 

Nate 
Portland, OR 
https://twitter.com/oakfive
